entry.title: libc++ roll broke only win-arm64-rel, somewhere in tflite
entry.content:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5447667 had a green CQ and landed through the CQ.
It broke https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/win-arm64-rel/897/overview and got reverted.
The error message is:
``` ../../third_party/tflite/src\tensorflow/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h(5715,15): error: no member named 'max' in namespace 'tflite::optimized_ops::depthwise_conv::std'; did you mean 'fmax'? 5715 | out_y = std::max(1, out_y); | ```
1. The error itself is weird. Why does it look in `::tflite::optimized_ops::depthwise_conv::std` instead of in, well, `::std`? I need to figure this out.
2. Since everything else is happy, chances are it's got something to do with tensorflow itself that we'll likely have to fix upstream. Also, it's somehow arm64-only? …aha, looking for "aarch64" in that file I see: [1]
``` namespace tflite { namespace optimized_ops { namespace depthwise_conv { // ... #if defined(__aarch64__) && !defined(GOOGLE_L4T) #include <stddef.h> ```
You can't include stddef.h inside a namespace! So that's an upstream bug. That #include needs to happen at the toplevel. Can someone on chrome-intelligence get that fixed upstream and rolled in?
3. This made it through the CQ. Why did this only break win/arm64? We also have arm64 builds on android and mac -- do those just happen to work? (If so, I suppose this is fine and should be rare and is bad luck – we likely don't have the resources to have win/arm64 builders on the CQ by default?)
1: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/tflite/src/tensorflow/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h;l=52?q=depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h

entry.title: CoreML: Support passing weights that are not int32/fp32/fp16
entry.content:
We currently use coreml "const" op to save all the constant operands, before start parsing the model operations list. Then during operation parsing, just reference the output of const ops as inputs to certain ops. This works fine for now, if the constant operands are all int32/fp32/fp16. There are some operations with quantized weights(int8), for these cases, we can't use "const". We can specify the constant directly in the op's input as `Value`, the only thing is then these constants have to be repeatedly specified if they are used in multiple ops(which is probably fine, they just reference the same offset in the weight file).
Need further investigations on the behavior differences between a "const" op and directly specified input `Value`.

entry.title: Suspended tabs do not reload when a tab group is hidden and then unhidden
entry.content:
Google Chrome 123.0.6312.107 (Official Build) (arm64) OS macOS Version 14.4.1 (Build 23E224) JavaScript V8 12.3.219.16
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Ensure Memory Saver setting is enabled (2) Add tabs to a new group (3) Wait until some/all tabs are suspended by the memory saver (4) Enable "Save Group" (5) Hide group (6) Unhide group
What is the expected result? All tabs should reload with the url that they were on when the group was hiden/
What happens instead? When unhidden, suspended tabs have no url. A blank/default "new tab" window is loaded in its place.
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Tests are failing: scoped_refptr.h(284): Check failed: ptr_.
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): scoped_refptr.h(284): Check failed: ptr_.
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/HistoryManipulationInterventionBrowserTest.PDFSkipOnBackForwardNoUserGesture - ninja://chrome/test:unit_tests/NoteTakingHelperTest.PreferredAppEnabledOnLockScreen - ninja://chrome/test:unit_tests/NoteTakingHelperTest.ListChromeAppsWithLockScreenNotesSupported - ninja://chrome/test:interactive_ui_tests/SignInViewControllerBrowserTest.EmailConfirmationDefaultFocus - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/HistoryManipulationInterventionBrowserTest.PDFDoNotSkipOnBackForwardDueToUserGesture
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/8857f669c5e0f84668fe7fa6ababef5b
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: FPS drops when moving mouse while WebRTC streaming
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Start provided webrtc.html code in Chromium browser; 2. Click "Share screen", pick the whole display; 3. Click "Get Screen"; 4. You must see that your stream is started and below the stream you can see Sender FPS and Receiver FPS values. 5. Start moving mouse on streamed display and look for FPS values. They will decrease from 60 to 40-50~.
# Problem Description Firstly, I must say that I'm on KDE, Wayland When we're streaming the display and moving the mouse on that screen, the FPS of the stream slightly drops.
# Additional Comments Tested in Firefox, where I get very stable 60 FPS.
# Summary FPS drops when moving mouse while WebRTC streaming
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>WebRTC
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Change driver from ChromeTabbedActivityTestRule to ChromeTabbedActivity/ChromeActivity
Tooltips for title="..." text is truncated
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 122.0.6261.137 (Official Build) (64-bit) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: ChromeOS
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Hover over the comic at https://xkcd.com/1053/
What is the expected result?
See a tooltip with the full message 'Saying "what kind of an idiot doesn't know about the Yellowstone supervolcano" is so much more boring than telling someone about the Yellowstone supervolcano for the first time.'
What happens instead?
The tooltip is truncated, with the last five words missing (the tooltip ends with "Yellowstone ...")
I can imagine that tooltip truncation may be needed in some circumstances, but this seems way too aggressive. This breaks many popular webcomics that put hidden messages in the title text, including xkcd.

entry.title: Actions fired through accessibility clients do not count as user gestures
entry.content: # Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Download a file, e.g., from data:text/html,sample.txt 2. Navigate to chrome://downloads. You should see the downloaded item. 3. Using an accessibility client (e.g., Windows Accessibility Insights or Windows Voice Access), try to open the downloaded item. # Problem Description WebUIs use WebContents::HasRecentInteraction to ensure that sensitive actions come from the user [1]. Opening a downloaded item is one such action. However, gestures that are generated by accessibility clients on behalf of the user fail this check. [1]: https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40090860 # Summary Actions fired through accessibility clients do not count as user gestures # Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Pages go missing with 9-up printing
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.123 OS: Win, macOS, Linux, ChromeOS
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Open a 10 page PDF document, where the pages are all A4 paper size. (E.g., attached 10p.pdf) (2) Initiate Print Preview (CTRL+P( (3) Under "More settings": (a) Ensure "Paper size" is A4 (b) Select a "Pages per sheet" value of 9.
What is the expected result?
The first sheet should should 9 pages.
What happens instead?
The first sheet only shows pages 1 through 6. Pages 7 through 9 are missing. Page 10 is visible on the second sheet.
Running a bisection gave a result of: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/9c087d96260f4ab469c332120a7a1217455f7693..286b3d20f5cf71f08db0bf7a74b857f891c1cf61
From that list, the likely suspect is https://crrev.com/1160870.

entry.title: Tests are failing: webgpu_cts_integration_test_base.py(389): AssertionError: webgpu:shader,validation,decl,context_dependent_resolution:builtin_value_names:case=\"ins...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): webgpu_cts_integration_test_base.py(389): AssertionError: webgpu:shader,validation,decl,context_dependent_resolution:builtin_value_names:case="instance_index" failed
 - VALIDATION FAILED: subcase: decl="override"
 Unexpected compilationInfo 'error' message.
 5:20: error: cannot use 'override instance_index' as builtin value
 2:5: info: 'override instance_index' declared here

entry.title: [FedCM] Add factory method to initialize FedCmModalDialogView
entry.content: In the case of a use other account pop-up being open and the user clicks on the use other account button again, we want to destroy and re-initialize FedCmModalDialogView. FedCmModalDialogView is a mock in tests and we cannot easily re-initialize the mock without a factory method.

entry.title: Support Activity transitions (ChromeTabbedActivity -> SettingsActivity)
The app crashes if you try to move a tab from one group
RTL scrolling broken in contenteditable
entry.content:
The expectation for this test:
virtual/text-antialias/ellipsis-rtl-text-in-rtl-flow-underline-composition.html
... shows the text area scrolled to the left beyond the content text and beyond the ellipsis, which is incorrect. It should be at scroll offset zero, which is all the way to the right.
A recent CL, which fixed an unrelated bug, also fixed the scroll offset for this test, so the CL included an updated (newly correct) expected.png:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349856/5/third_party/blink/web_tests/platform/linux/virtual/text-antialias/ellipsis-rtl-text-in-rtl-flow-underline-composition-expected.png
However, that CL was slightly incorrect and required another fix, and the second fix reverts this test to its previous (incorrect) behavior:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5446049/2/third_party/blink/web_tests/platform/linux/virtual/text-antialias/ellipsis-rtl-text-in-rtl-flow-underline-composition-expected.png
I don't know why either CL would cause the behavior of this test to change, but clearly it has something to do with RTL scrolling. When I play with the test case in a live browser, there appears to be more than one problem with RTL contenteditable: the cursor is placed to left, well beyond the ellipsis; sometimes the cursor is invisible; pasting additional text is hit-or-miss. Seems like there is a constellation of problems here, of which the scroll offset is but one.

entry.title: [Web Install API] Enable Installation of Web Apps from Web Content
entry.content:
The Web Install API allows a web site to install a web app (same or cross domain). This functionality allows the creation of web-based catalogues that can install PWAs directly from the web and into multiple platforms.
https://aka.ms/webinstall

entry.title: AoA CaBLE over USB should be available even if the machine does not have bluetooth
entry.content: It would be nice if users could sign in with a passkey on their phone even if their machine does not have bluetooth. It feels wrong to gate AoA support on starting a CaBLE flow, which in turn depends on having bluetooth available.

entry.title: add ShadowChromeFileProvider will cause ChromeFileProviderTest to use ShadowSystemClock
entry.content:
ShadowChromeFileProvider: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4vRfTkyRZsaXLQR
CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5441563/3
Test failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/android-x86-rel/b8751070649126085665/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid%3Achrome_junit_tests%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.util.ChromeFileProviderTest%23testFileChanged%5B28%5D+VHash%3A1a06b6892bc76ed9&sortby=&groupby=
The failure in ChromeFileProvider is due to unexpected usage of ShadowSystemClock. With ShadowSystemClock the System.nanoTime() is always the same value. And the uri we created in ChromeFileProvider is based on that time. Thus all the Uri we created are identical, which is causing the test failure. It is unclear why adding ShadowChromeFileProvider will cause ChromeFileProviderTest to use ShadowSystemClock.
When we run PdfPageUnitTest and ChromeFileProviderTest separately; they could pass. We could get the real System.nanoTime(): getFileUriWhenReady, uri = /BlockedFile_1997478175568834 getFileUriWhenReady, uri = /BlockedFile_1997478175667472
When the test failed (PdfPageUnitTest and ChromeFileProviderTest are run in sequence), the uri created is : getFileUriWhenReady, uri = /BlockedFile_100000000

entry.title: Window on wrong screen / desktop gets focus when switching to Chrome on macOS
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open window 1 on screen 1, and window 2 on screen 2. 2. Focus on window 2. 3. Cmd+tab to an app that has a window on screen 2. 4. Cmd+tab back to Chrome, and see window 1 in focus.
# Problem Description When you cmd+tab to Chrome, it always focuses the top window on the "main" screen, rather than the top window on the screen that previously had a window in focus. Apple apps focus on the top window on the screen / desktop that last had focus, if the app being switched to has a window on that screen.
The specific case that has annoyed me a bunch of times looks like: 1. Work in Chrome window open on second monitor, but have another window open on laptop monitor. 2. Cmd+tab to something like Music, on the same monitor, and quickly cmd+tab back after doing something. 3. Looking at the same window I was working in, think "I don't need this tab anymore" and press cmd+w. 4. A tab I wasn't looking at on a different window closes!
# Summary Window on wrong screen / desktop gets focus when switching to Chrome on macOS
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: pinpoint: Make number of runs for Speedometer3 match Speedometer2
entry.content: There is logic to increase the number of default runs when submitting a pinpoint job for Speedometer2, but not for Speedometer3. Please make the default number of runs for Speedometer3 match Speedometer2.

entry.title: Attempting to open link from within an application running in WINE coredumps Chromium
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem I'm sorry about these reproduction steps, I'm sure there are easier examples, but this is how I initially noticed the issue.
1. Set Chromium as your default browser, if not already 2. Download the Guild Wars 2 installer (can be found here: https://account.arena.net/welcome ), and run it through WINE (you may have to change the Windows version via winecfg since WINE defaults to Windows XP ... ), i.e. `wine ~/Downloads/Gw2Setup-64.exe` 3. Tail the journal via a terminal, i.e. `journalctl -f` 4. Once the installer/launcher has initialised, you will see 5 links right under the Guild Wars 2 logo, click any or all of them 5. Depending on your Desktop Environment you may or may not see it trying to launch Chromium, however it never does 6. In the journal you will notice a plethora of entries, among them a coredump of Chromium and - curiously - chrome_crashpad
# Problem Description Clicking any or all of the links in the launcher should open the link in the default browser. This doesn't work when Chromium is the default, however it does work for Firefox. So it appears to not be a an issue with how WINE handles these links, but rather how Chromium processes them once passed to it.
I know this used to work in the past, however I cannot say when exactly it stopped working. It worked about a year ago (I'm fairly confident) and broke one day, but I assumed it was due to a WINE update. Only now that I actually looked into this I noticed it is not in fact a WINE issue, but rather appears to be a Chromium issue.
It should be noted this is not isolated to Guild Wars 2, I noticed the same issue when playing Elder Scrolls Online. I am sure there are other affected applications, but these are the 2 I noticed it on.
In the attachments I tried running the coredumps through gdb, but it appears that Fedora is not shipping debug infos for Chromium, so they are not exactly detailed, sorry.
# Summary Attempting to open link from within an application running in WINE coredumps Chromium
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? Just one tab
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

[7035:259:0411/122352.268751:INFO:indexed_db_browsertest.cc(133)] Navigation done. ../../content/browser/indexed_db/indexed_db_browsertest.cc:138: Failure Failed Failed: Starting...The pre-existing leveldb has an objectStore in 'database-basics',

entry.title: apk size regression for M124
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 124.0.6367.29 OS: Android, arm64
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) build ChromePublic.apk with the provided gn args (2) check the apk size
What is the expected result? about 220MB, the same as for M123
What happens instead? 246.1MB (+26MB)
After update from M123 to M124 android apk size was increased from 220.8MB to 246.1MB 220.8 MB: commit 399174dbe6eff0f59de9a6096129c0c827002b3a (tag: 123.0.6312.105) 246.1MB: commit 9e6ded5ac1ff5e38d930ae52bd9aec09bd1a68e4 (tag: 124.0.6367.29)
gn args: target_os = "android" target_cpu = "arm64" is_official_build = true is_debug = false proprietary_codecs = true ffmpeg_branding = "Chrome" chrome_pgo_phase = 0
An linked Brave bug: https://github.com/brave/brave-browser/issues/37457 Both PGO and non-PGO builds are affected.
P.S. I can't create the bug with under Chromium > Speed > BinarySize component, consider moving
